intro: Geissospermum laeve, commonly known as the smooth geissosperm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the southern United States and Mexico, where it typically grows in dry, open habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and trifoliate leaves with smooth, lance-shaped leaflets. Its showy, yellow-orange flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom in the summer months. The fruit is a legume pod that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
